Once the band-shifted, bias-corrected, merged, multi-sensor
R
r s
values were generated at the SeaWiFS wavelengths, each pixel on each day was classified optically, using a fuzzy-logic approach [ 64, 65, 66]. In v1, the optical classes used were those provided by Moore et al. [ 64] (2009), with supplementary classes for coccolithophores provided by Moore et al. [ 65] (2012). In all subsequent versions, optical classes were custom generated using representative
R
r s
spectra sampled from the corresponding
R
r s
product for that version, as explained in Jackson et al. [ 66], with the coccolithophore classes from Moore et al. [ 65] retained in all versions.
